identificationModule.briefTitle: A Double-Masked Comparison of FID 123320 Ophthalmic Solution to Vehicle for the Reduction of Ocular Redness
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Double-Masked Comparison of Apraclonidine Hydrochloride Ophthalmic Solution to Vehicle for the Reduction of Ocular Redness

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and efficacy of Apraclonidine Hydrochloride Ophthalmic Solution 0.125% when compared to Vehicle, in relieving redness of the eye due to minor eye irritations. This study will be conducted in the United States.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The study will consist of six (6) scheduled visits: Screening and/or Baseline Visit (Day -7 to -1), Eligibility Confirmation/Randomization/1st Treatment Visit (Day 1), Week 2 Follow-Up Visit (Day 14), Week 4 Follow-Up Visit (Day 28), Week 8 Follow-Up/Treatment Discontinuation Visit (Day 56) and Exit Visit (Day 63). The expected individual duration of participation in the study is approximately 10 weeks with approximately 56 days of exposure to the investigational product.

armGroups.label: Apraclonidine Hydrochloride Ophthalmic Solution
armGroups.description: One drop in each eye on Day 1, followed by 2 drops in each eye on Day 2 onward for approximately 8 weeks

armGroups.label: Vehicle
armGroups.description: One drop in each eye on Day 1, followed by 2 drops in each eye on Day 2 onward for approximately 8 weeks

interventions.name: Apraclonidine Hydrochloride Ophthalmic Solution
interventions.description: Investigational ophthalmic solution applied topically to the eye with a dropper bottle

interventions.name: Vehicle
interventions.description: Vehicle (inactive ingredients) applied topically to the eye with a dropper bottle

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in investigator-assessed ocular redness at 15 minutes post-instillation on Day 1
primaryOutcomes.description: Ocular redness will be assessed by the investigator using a scale from 0 to 4 in half-unit increments (0=none; 4=extremely severe). This endpoint is co-primary with the 10 hours post-instillation endpoint.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in investigator-assessed ocular redness at 10 hours (600 minutes) post-instillation on Day 1
primaryOutcomes.description: Ocular redness will be assessed by the investigator using a scale from 0 to 4 in half-unit increments (0=none; 4=extremely severe). This endpoint is co-primary with the 15 minutes post-instillation endpoint.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in investigator-assessed ocular redness at 1 minute post-instillation on Day 1
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ocular redness will be assessed by the investigator using a scale from 0 to 4 in half-unit increments (0=none; 4=extremely severe).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in investigator-assessed ocular redness at 8 hours (480 minutes) post-instillation on Day 1
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ocular redness will be assessed by the investigator using a scale from 0 to 4 in half-unit increments (0=none; 4=extremely severe).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in investigator-assessed ocular redness at 12 hours (720 minutes) post-instillation on Day 1
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ocular redness will be assessed by the investigator using a scale from 0 to 4 in half-unit increments (0=none; 4=extremely severe).

locations.facility: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations
